ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Is it possible to make tomorrow a sunny day by drawing a picture of the sun?
Is it possible for dogs to fly?
Is it possible that you could cause a car crash just by thinking about it?
Is it possible that a friend could get the flu just because you argued with them?
Is it possible to crash your bicycle by going too fast?
Is it possible to make something good happen to you or someone else just by thinking about it?
Is it possible to do really well at a test at school just by crossing your fingers?
Is it possible to lose a race just because you lost your lucky mascot or lucky charm?
Is it possible for you to get the flu just because you were rude to your parents?
Is it possible for stones to float in water?
Is it possible that if mommy or daddy is quite ill, you could make them better by thinking or wishing it?
Is it possible for snow to melt?
Is it possible for a friend to get into trouble with a teacher at school just because you were thinking about it?
Is it possible to make a rainbow disappear by clicking your fingers?
Is it possible to make a bully leave your school just by always avoiding walking past their house?
Is it possible to burn yourself with cold water?
Is it possible to show you are happy by smiling?
Is it possible to move an object across a room just by thinking about it?
Is it possible that you could win a bike in a raffle just by thinking really hard of your ticket?
Is it possible to make something bad happen by standing on cracks in the pavement?
Is it possible to think of a balloon floating in the sky?
Is it possible for your mommy or daddy to change their job just by you thinking or wishing about it?
Is it possible to ride a bicycle with no wheels?
Is it possible to make a train run on time just by walking up and down the station platform?
Is it possible to cause something bad to happen just by thinking about it?
Is it possible for glass to break?
Is it possible to prevent a plane crash just by touching wood?
Is it possible to prevent an accident just by thinking or wishing it?
Is it possible to cause an argument between mommy and daddy just by thinking about it?
Is it possible for you to lift an elephant?
Magical Thinking Questionnaire (MTQ) - Thought Subscore
Magical Thinking Questionnaire (MTQ) - Action Subscore
Magical Thinking Questionnaire (MTQ) - Total Score
Notes: Sum of Thought and Action subscores (20 items magical_1, 3, 4, 6-9, 11, 13-15, 18-20, 22, 24, 25, 27-29)

ElementDescription: Magical Thinking Questionnaire (MTQ) - Estimated Bias
Notes: Number of items magical_5, 12, 17, 21, 26 incorrectly answered ''No'' and items magical_2, 10, 16, 23, 30 incorrectly answered ''Yes''
